did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, printed materials, research materials, computer media.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection contains course material, class notes, papers and talks by Peter and correspondence.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Jacob Gould Schurman Professor Emeritus of German and Comparative Literature at Cornell University. Professor Hohendahl's teaching and research interests include eighteenth to twentieth century German literature, especially Enlightenment, Vormärz (Heine, Büchner), and Modernism (Benn, Jünger); intellectual history; literary, political and social theory with emphasis on Critical Theory (Adorno, Benjamin, Habermas); comparative literature with emphasis on eighteenth and nineteenth-century European literature and philosophy; history of science with emphasis on the humanities (history of German studies, history of the university). Editor of the monograph series Signale: Modern German Letters, Cultures, and Thought, published by Cornell University Press.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection contains course material, class notes, papers and talks by Peter and correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to letters restricted to permission of Peter Hohendahl (Box 1 and 2).
Access to emails restricted until after death of Peter Hohendahl (electronic records).

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Peter Uwe Hohendahl papers, #14-18-4241. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Sets of floppy disks containing essays, letters, course material, research and "literarische kultur im zeitalter des liberalismus"
